CS @ Wellesley
Getting started in CS at Wellesley may not always be easy for you to navigate, and we understand that. To help you, we’ve compiled some resources the department and community provides for you!

To get started, you can:

check out what we have!

Wellesley’s CS Community Spotlight:

If You Can See It, You Can Be It - Wellesley in Tech

A project that aims to display nonbinary people and women of color from Wellesley working in tech! All of these people on the website are open to connecting with you.



CS Orgs at Wellesley

There are many CS orgs at Wellesley that may provide the resources specific to your CS path, help you learn more about CS paths you weren’t previously aware about, or help you find other like-minded CS students to connect with!

CS Club

Wellesley’s Computer Science Club provides resources and tech-related events (including WHACK, Wellesley’s own hackathon)!

Wellesley in Product

Wellesley in Product is an org for all those interested in product, be it product or UI/UX design, product management, and more!

Google Developer Student Club

Wellesley’s GDSC is an excellent community for aspiring developers looking to translate their classwork into real, tangible projects.



Game Dev Club

Wellesley’s Game Dev Club holds events all about getting to game dev and making games of your own!

Coding Club

A weekly gathering to work on programming problems commonly seen in technical interviews! If you’re in the CS-student google group, you’ll receive updates from Lyn Turbak and Scott Anderson about when and where they’re held!

WHACK

Wellesley’s annual hackathon event! Keep on the lookout for updates on how to join the organizing committee or participate in a fun, tech-filled weekend!



Student Interdisciplinary Data Initiative

The Student Interdisciplinary Data Initiative (SIDI) is a network for data science students and all data enthusiasts to foster interdisciplinary conversations on data!

Wellesley ColorStack

ColorStack is a national organization that has a Wellesley chapter, meant to support Black and Latinx students in their academic and career paths in CS!

Wellesley Engineering Society

Dedicated to any level of engineering enthusiast, WES allows you to learn about engineering through projects and pursue engineering opportunities!





Contact Us


This site is only possible through the efforts of students and educators like you. If you have a resource you think could be added to the page, an idea for a page on TransparenCS, or any critiques, suggestions, funny memes, questions, or poems, please contact us!
